attributes.action: Change the definition of rape to include forced to penetrate
attributes.additional_details:
The current definition for rape in the UK is given by the 2003 Sexual Offences Act and is as follows:

1-(1) A person (A) commits an offence if—

    (a) he intentionally penetrates the vagina, anus or mouth of another person (B) with his penis,
    (b) B does not consent to the penetration, and
    (c) A does not reasonably believe that B consents.

This definition only includes the forced sexual conduct of a man on a man/woman, according to the law it is impossible for a woman to rape a man.

We therefore feel that it is appropriate for the definition of rape be redefined to also include a man/woman being forced to penetrate to make the law gender neutral.
